list_definition.definition: to put an end to or make useless; to ruin

list_ex_of_english: As in 1822, severe weather during the previous autumn had destroyed crops and resulted in food shortages during the early part of the year.
One is sighted before the other and this first effect, however slight and transient, immediately destroys the perfect symmetry.
If these become damaged or even destroyed by exogenous influences the continuation of a specie may be in danger.
If these snails are subsequently exposed to normal miracidia, the parasites are quickly destroyed by amoebocytes near the penetration area in the head-foot.
They destroyed the power structure, leaving the masks lying on the floor, impotent without their bundled remains.
Many houses (house) were destroyed by the flood last week.
By contrast, imperative data structures are typically ephemeral: an update destroys the old version of the data structure.
Each of the actions performed by the robot results in correlations newly established between the objects, with some old correlations being destroyed.
